definitions.definition: action taken to improve or help a situation

examples.text: calls for government intervention to save the steel industry
In the second group of states, direct intervention in the economy was limited.

definitions.definition: action by a country to become involved in the affairs of another country when they have not been asked to do so

examples.text: NATO intervention in the troubled region

definitions.definition: action taken to improve a medical condition or illness

examples.text: Most patients make a recovery without further intervention.

definitions.definition: the act of interrupting somebody when they are speaking in order to say something

examples.text: People resented his repeated interventions in the debate.

definitions.definition: an occasion when a group of people meet to take action with a friend or family member who has an addiction to drugs or alcohol, in order to help them recover

examples.text: Family intervention is an essential component of treatment for adolescent drug abuse.
